result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
10:40 AM Defendant Daniel Louis Snider in court.  Attorney Michael Arthur Kelsey in court for Daniel Louis Snider.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Court reviews court record. Court comments on setting a preliminary hearing date, Atty Kelsey agrees. Court schedules Preliminary Hearing.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for December 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on December 14, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:04 AM Judge Annette Barna appears by video from Rusk County .Defendant Daniel Louis Snider in court.  Attorney Michael Arthur Kelsey in court for Daniel Louis Snider.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Def Atty makes statement from letter filed, asks for one more status conference, discussion follows for scheduling. Court Schedules.
Status conference scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Status conference on October 20, 2022 at 10:45 am.
Scheduling conference on September 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 7, 2022 at 09:00 am.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt:
10:29 AM Judge Steven Anderson appears by video from Rusk County Defendant Daniel Louis Snider in court, with Attorney Michael Arthur Kelsey, both appearing in person.  Attorney Jennifer Gross in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, Atty Kelsey acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint, indicates all demographic information contained in the complaint is correct.  Atty Kelsey waives time limits for preliminary hearing but not hearing, requesting STC set before prelim for discovery.  Court questions DEF on waiver of prelim, Court finds DEF knowingly, intelligently, freely, and voluntarily waives time limits for preliminary hearing.
Status conference scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on June 1, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt:
11:04 AM Defendant Daniel L. Snider  in court, in custody appears by video.  Attny Michael Kelsey appear in court.  Jennifer Gross appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Probable Cause found by court.  State makes bond recommendation.  Attny Kelsey argues bond.   Court sets bond. CBS $300    ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-338-3976 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.   INITIAL APPEARANCE set for  Tuesday, April 12, 2022.
